excel_data = pd.ExcelFile(file_path)

# Checking sheet names to understand structure

sheet_names

# Load the data from the identified sheet to inspect its structure
data = excel_data.parse('Directory_2024-10-30_812')

# Display the first few rows to understand the column structure and identify the 'size of building' column

content.text:
# Sort the data by the column containing the ZIP code. Based on the inspection, ZIP codes appear in the 7th column.
# Sorting by this column to provide the organized data by ZIP code.

# Renaming columns for easier reference
data_skip.columns = [f"Column_{i}" for i in range(len(data_skip.columns))]

# Sort by the ZIP code column (Column_7)
sorted_data = data_skip.sort_values(by="Column_7")

import ace_tools as tools; tools.display_dataframe_to_user(name="Sorted Directory by ZIP Code", dataframe=sorted_data)

Certainly! Which specific certification type(s) would you like to filter by? Some examples from this dataset include "MBE," "DBE," "SBE," or other certification markers. Let me know the type(s) you're interested in, and I'll apply the filter accordingly.
